legal.api.content:
Example: Retrieve a specific ticket

Make a GET request to /api/v1/tickets/{ticketId}.

Successful response (200 OK)

{
  "id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "title": "Printer issue",
  "status": "Open",
  ...
}

Common Errors

  • 401 Unauthorized: Your API key is missing, invalid, or expired.
  • 404 Not Found: The ticket with the specified ID does not exist.
  • 429 Too Many Requests: You have exceeded the allowed request limit.
legal.api.title: API Call Examples & Common Errors
legal.cgu.content:
Article 1: Purpose

These Terms of Service (ToS) govern the use of the Nexus Support Hub application (hereinafter "the Application"). Use of the Application implies full acceptance of these ToS.

Article 2: Access to the Application

Access is reserved for users with a valid account. The user is responsible for keeping their login credentials confidential.

Article 3: User Obligations

The user agrees to use the Application in accordance with the law and these ToS. Any fraudulent or abusive use, including submitting illegal or offensive content, is prohibited.
legal.cgu.title: Terms of Service (ToS)
legal.integration.content:
Overview

This guide provides a basic overview of how to integrate with Nexus Support Hub. Integration is mainly via our RESTful API, allowing you to create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) support tickets.

Authentication

Each API request must be authenticated using an API key you can generate from your Manager dashboard. The key must be included in the request header as follows:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Create a ticket

To create a new ticket, make a POST request to the /api/v1/tickets endpoint with a JSON body containing the ticket details.

{
  "title": "Printer issue",
  "description": "The printer on the 3rd floor is not responding.",
  "priority": "High",
  "user_email": "user@example.com"
}
legal.integration.title: Simple Integration Guide
legal.ip.content:
Ownership

The Nexus Support Hub application is the intellectual property of REP&WEB.

Creator and lead developer: Harbi Amine (REP&WEB).

Support contact email: hubnexusinfo@gmail.com
legal.ip.title: Intellectual Property
legal.pricing.content:
Pricing Plans

We offer several service levels to meet your needs. Please see our official pricing page for the latest details (link coming soon).

  • Basic: Ideal for small teams.
  • Professional: For growing businesses with greater needs.
  • Enterprise: Custom solutions with dedicated support.

Billing

Billing is monthly or yearly, depending on the chosen plan. Payments are securely processed via our payment partner. You can manage your billing info and view invoices from your Manager dashboard.
legal.pricing.title: Pricing & Billing
legal.privacy.content:
1. Data Collection

We collect information you provide directly, such as your name, email address, and support ticket content. This data is necessary to provide and improve the service.

2. Data Use

Your data is used exclusively for support ticket management, improving our AI assistant, and communicating with you. We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties for marketing purposes.

3. Your Rights

In accordance with GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, delete, and port your data. You can exercise these rights by contacting our support at the address in the Intellectual Property section.
legal.privacy.title: Privacy Policy (GDPR Compliant)
legal.security.content:
Request Limits (Rate Limiting)

To ensure service stability for all clients, API requests are limited to 100 requests per minute per API key. If you exceed this limit, you will receive a 429 status code response.

Data Security

All data between your client and our servers is encrypted using TLS 1.2 or higher. Passwords are hashed and salted, and sensitive data at rest is encrypted. We regularly conduct security audits to ensure your information is protected.
legal.security.title: Limits & Security Information
legal.sla.content:
Service Level Agreement (SLA)

We commit to 99.9% service availability for our Professional and Enterprise plans. Availability is calculated monthly, excluding planned maintenance. If this commitment is not met, service credits may be applied.

Technical Support

Support is available via the application's ticket system. Response times vary by plan:

  • Basic: Response within 24 business hours.
  • Professional: Response within 8 business hours.
  • Enterprise: Response within 4 hours, 24/7 for critical issues.
legal.sla.title: SLA & Support

promotional.section.pricing.content:
Recommended Positioning for Nexus Support Hub

  • Freemium: Free for up to 3 agents / 200 tickets/month with basic AI.
  • Standard: â‚¬10/agent/month with full AI, auto-categorization, SLA.
  • Pro: â‚¬20/agent/month with voice commands, multilingual support, appointments.
  • AI Usage: â‚¬0.02â€“â‚¬0.05/ticket to cover Gemini costs.
  • Enterprise: On demand, with CRM integration, SLA & premium support.

ðŸ’¡ A rate of â‚¬10/agent/month places Nexus in the accessible SME + AI segment, very competitive against the existing $15â€“$40/agent/month.

userManual.section.gettingStarted.agentU: Navigate to the Sign Up page.
In the "Existing Company Name" field, enter the exact company name provided by your manager.
Complete the form and click "Sign Up". You will now be part of your company's team.
For Agents & Users: Joining a Company
userManual.section.gettingStarted.intro: Welcome to Nexus Support Hub! Your role determines how you sign up and interact with the system.
userManual.section.gettingStarted.manage: Navigate to the Sign Up page.
Select the "Manager" role from the dropdown.
A "Secret Code" field will appear. Enter the creation code `123456` to prove you are authorized to create a new company.
Enter your new, unique Company Name. This name is critical, as your team will use it to log in.
Complete the rest of the form and click "Sign Up".
userManual.section.gettingStarted.title: 1. Getting Started: Account Creation
userManual.section.usingTheApp.agent.des: Agents can view unassigned tickets and take ownership of them. You can also see a list of tickets currently assigned to you. Open any ticket to communicate with the user and resolve their issue.
userManual.section.usingTheApp.login.des: To log in, you will always need three pieces of information: your email, your password, and your company's name.
userManual.section.usingTheApp.manager.d: The Manager Dashboard provides a complete overview. You can:
userManual.section.usingTheApp.manager.f: View all tickets in the system, regardless of who they are assigned to.
Assign or re-assign tickets to available agents.
Filter tickets to analyze trends and performance.
Manage users: update their roles (e.g., promote a User to an Agent) or delete users.
userManual.section.usingTheApp.title: 2. Using the Application
userManual.section.usingTheApp.user.desc: As a user, your main goal is to get help. Click "Get AI Help" to start a chat with our AI assistant, Nexus. Describe your problem, and Nexus will guide you. If it cannot solve the issue, it will suggest creating a ticket, which you can finalize and submit.
userManual.section.voice.desc: The application includes voice features to enhance your experience. You can use your microphone to dictate messages in the chat, and the AI's responses can be read aloud automatically. Use the speaker and microphone icons to control these features.
userManual.section.voice.title: 3. Voice Features
video.widget.title: Discover Nexus
